<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 3"
    pfs=""
>
[Additional Circus Trick](/Feats.aspx?ID=2688) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Circus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=375" />
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Come One, Come All, to the Extinction Curse Player’s Guide!](/Sources.aspx?ID=83) pg. 0</row>

**Prerequisites**
You must have a signature trick

</column>

---

Your signature trick can have one additional trait beyond the number provided in Table 2: Trick Progression on page 63 of _Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On_. If the trick trait has an associated skill (such as [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) with the [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72) trait) and that skill is one of your trick checks, your checks with that skill to Perform a Trick aren't penalized if you Perform a Trick using a different skill. For example, if your signature trick has [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) and Intimidation as trick checks and you take this feat to add the fire trait, you can Perform a Trick using Acrobatics (at no penalty), then Acrobatics again (at a -5 penalty), and then Intimidation (at no penalty).
